> >The only problem with this approach is that you are very limited  in 
> =
>the objects you can pass via annotations (only primitive types, and 
> >th=
is approach won't work for methods that accept more than 
> one parameter).=


>   More importantly, it is a bad idea to use annotations to 
> pass the =
data! Anotations should give the hints (tags, 
> markers) how to get the da=
ta but not the data itself.

Why is that? Say I was testing a method which =
validates strings, why
should I add a level of redirection to the test? Wha=
t's the benefit?

Jon
